meanings.definition: To tie the legs of a horse or other animal together to prevent it from running away.
meanings.sent1: I had to hopple the goat to keep it from wandering off.
meanings.sent2: The farmer would hopple the horses before leaving the barn.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous pig managed to hopple itself and looked quite silly.
meanings.sent4: The vines hoppled around the tree, creating a natural barrier.
meanings.sent5: The rope hoppled the cow's legs, securing it in place.

meanings.definition: A device used to hobble an animal by tying its legs together.
meanings.sent1: The hopple was made of sturdy leather and metal rings.
meanings.sent2: The farmer grabbed the hopple to restrain the runaway calf.
meanings.sent3: The hopple jingled softly as the horse moved around the stable.
meanings.sent4: The hopple lay forgotten in the corner of the barn, covered in dust.
meanings.sent5: The hopple clinked as it was fastened around the sheep's legs.

meanings.definition: To move with a limp or hobble.
meanings.sent1: The injured dog had to hopple back home slowly.
meanings.sent2: She hoppled along the path, trying not to put weight on her sprained ankle.
meanings.sent3: The penguin hoppled comically across the ice, slipping and sliding.
meanings.sent4: The old car hoppled down the road, struggling to maintain speed.
meanings.sent5: The tired hiker hoppled up the steep hill, panting heavily.
